the sword of Godric Gryffindor.

	Snape's silver doe Patronus leads Harry to a frozen pond where the sword is hidden. Even though the goblin Griphook eventually ends up with the sword (which Griphook considers goblin property by rights), the Sorting Hat produces the beautiful silver, ruby-studded weapon once more for Neville Longbottom.

questions.correct: Mr Ollivander & Mr. Ollivander & Mister Ollivander
questions.explanation:
Mr Ollivander & Mr. Ollivander & Mister Ollivander

	Voldemort captures and tortures him to learn why Harry's wand is so powerful against the Dark Lord's. Ollivander is the wandmaker who crafted Harry's and Tom Riddle's wands, which have twin Phoenix feather cores.

Lily Evans and Severus Snape.

	This loving friendship (or romance, on Snape's side) was the reason that Snape always COULD be trusted--Dumbledore was right about him, after all!

the silver doe.

questions.explanation:
Bill Weasley and Fleur Delacour.

	They marry in Chapter Eight, and then go off to live in Shell Cottage. Presumeably, they are the parents of Victoire, who snogs Teddy Lupin in the last chapter.

Nagini.

	During Book 7, Voldemort's snake (who is also one of his Horcruxes) spends time inside the rotting corpse of Bathilda Bagshot and floating in a "glittering, charmed cage, like a monstrous halo" over Voldemort's head. Finally, Neville Longbottom slices off Nagini's head with the Sword of Gryffindor.

Ariana Dumbledore.

	Sister to Albus and Aberforth, Ariana Dumbledore accidentally kills her mother, Kendra. When Ariana is a child, a Muggle attack renders her mentally unstable. A magical fight among her brothers and Gellert Grindelwald results in Ariana's death. Rhiannon, by the way, is a Celtic horse goddess.

Dobby the house elf.

	Noble Dobby gives his life to rescue Harry and his friends from Malfoy Manor. His gravestone reads: "Here lies Dobby, a free elf."

Mad Eye Moody & Mad-Eye Moody.

	Death Eaters kill gallant Mad-Eye Moody on the journey from Privet Drive to the Burrow.

the Deluminator.

	Dumbledore leaves the Deluminator to Ron Weasley in his will. It turns out to be a very useful tool.

questions.explanation:
The Tales of Beedle the Bard.

	Dumbledore's bequest to Hermione. Beedle's "Tale of the Three Brothers" reveals the secret of the three Deathly Hallows.

questions.correct: Platform Nine and Three Quarters & Platform Nine and Three-Quarters
questions.explanation:
Platform Nine and Three Quarters & Platform Nine and Three-Quarters.

	This scene happens 19 years after most of the book takes place. Harry and Ginny Potter (and their young daughter, Lily) have brought their sons James and Albus to catch the Hogwarts train. There they meet, and/or talk about, many old friends. (And old enemies such as Draco Malfoy, who's there with his wife and son.) We learn that Neville is now a Hogwarts professor--teaching Herbology, of course. I love this scene. I wonder if J.K. Rowling will ever write another Harry Potter book. Probably not, I guess. But we can always hope.
